title: Bulk queue
summary: In queueing theory, a discipline within the mathematical theory of probability,  a bulk queue[1] (sometimes batch queue[2]) is a general queueing model where jobs arrive in and/or are served in groups of random size.[3]: vii  Batch arrivals have been used to describe large deliveries[4] and batch services to model a hospital out-patient department holding a clinic once a week,[5] a transport link with fixed capacity[6][7] and an elevator.[8]
